IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE WORKS TO PROTECT THE SCENIC, NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL RESOURCES OF THE COLUMBIA RIVER GORGE AREA TO ENSURE THE COLUMBIA GORGE REMAINS A BEAUTIFUL, WILD, AND UNSPOILED TREASURE FOR COMING GENERATIONS. LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE HAS WORKED FOR OVER THREE DECADES TO PROTECT THE COLUMBIA RIVER GORGE NATIONAL SCENIC AREA FROM IRRESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT, PRESERVE VITAL LANDS, PROMOTE RESPONSIBLE STEWARDSHIP, STRENGTHEN PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR KEY CONSERVATION INITIATIVES, EXPOSE LOCAL YOUTH TO THE COLUMBIA GORGE'S WONDERS, AND ILLUSTRATE THE GORGE'S SIGNIFICANCE AS AN ICON OF THE PACIFIC NW AND NATIONAL TREASURE. LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG/ABOUT.
IRS990.Desc: CONSERVATION ADVOCACY & LEGAL PROGRAMS - KEEPING THE COLUMBIA GORGE WILD AND BEAUTIFUL IS THE CORE OF WHAT WE DO. FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE IS THE ONLY CONSERVATION ORGANIZATION DEDICATED SOLELY TO PROTECTING THE COLUMBIA GORGE. FOR ALMOST 40 YEARS WE HAVE USED A COMBINATION OF OLD-FASHIONED GRASSROOTS ADVOCACY, SOPHISTICATED LEGAL STRATEGIES, AND CUTTING-EDGE OUTREACH AND PUBLIC EDUCATION TOOLS TO PROTECT THE GORGE FROM RECKLESS DEVELOPMENT.OVER THE COURSE OF FY 2017-18, FRIENDS ACHIEVED A NUMBER OF MOMENTOUS WINS BY WORKING TOGETHER WITH OUR MEMBERS, COMMUNITY ADVOCATES, AND PARTNERS. THIS INCLUDED ORGANIZING HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF PNW RESIDENTS AS PART OF A SUCCESSFUL COLLATION CAMPAIGN TO DEFEAT THE VANCOUVER, WASHINGTON TESORO OIL TERMINAL PROPOSAL; PURSUING LEGAL ACTION AND HELPING GATHER NEARLY 500,000 PUBLIC COMMENTS TO PREVENT CONSTRUCTION OF THE PROPOSED LONGVIEW, WASHINGTON MILLENNIUM COAL EXPORT TERMINAL; WORKING THROUGH THE LEGAL SYSTEM TO STOP AN IRRESPONSIBLE RAIL DOUBLE TRACK PROJECT NEAR MOSIER, OREGON AND LITIGATING TO SUCCESSFULLY BLOCK CONSTRUCTION OF SEVERAL PROPOSED STRUCTURES ON PRIME GORGE FARMLAND THAT WOULD HAVE VIOLATED NATIONAL SCENIC AREA LAND USE RULES. LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG/2017-ACCOMPLISHMENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMS - A LARGE CROSS SECTION OF PUBLIC SUPPORT IS CRITICAL IF WE ARE TO PRESERVE THE COLUMBIA GORGE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE SEEKS TO ACTIVELY EDUCATE AND MOBILIZE THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN OUR EFFORTS TO PROTECT AND STEWARD THE GORGE. A VITAL TOOL IN OUR BROADER PUBLIC EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS IS THE THOUSANDS OF DEDICATED FRIENDS' MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS AND ACTIVISTS WHO LIVE IN AND AROUND THE GORGE.FROM OFFERING EDUCATIONAL HIKES TO ORGANIZING COMMUNITY FORUMS, FRIENDS' PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM ANNUALLY MANAGES A DIVERSE ASSORTMENT OF COMMUNICATION, PUBLIC EDUCATION, OUTDOOR YOUTH EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH INITIATIVES. ACCOMPLISHMENTS OVER THE PAST YEAR INCLUDE BRINGING OVER 320 MIDDLE SCHOOL YOUTH FROM WASHOUGAL AND PORTLAND OUT TO THE GORGE AS PART OF FRIENDS' OUTDOOR EDUCATION PROGRAM; MOBILIZING OVER 390 VOLUNTEERS (FOR A COMBINED 5,022 VOLUNTEER HOURS) TO HELP SERVE AS LAND STEWARDS AND TRAILHEAD AMBASSADORS; AND PARTNERING WITH A NOTED LOCAL PHOTO STUDIO ON A MULTIMEDIA CAMPAIGN TO SPOTLIGHT THE WORK OF NINE COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO SERVE AS MODEL "CARETAKERS OF THE GORGE." LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG/2017-ACCOMPLISHMENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: GORGE RESILLIENCE & EAGLE CREEK FIRE RESPONSE PROGRAMS - THE 2017 EAGLE CREEK FIRE HAD A DRAMATIC IMPACT ON THE GORGE, BURNING OVER 48,000 ACRES OF FOREST AND SHUTTERING MILES OF BELOVED TRAILS AND STATE LANDMARKS. SHORTLY AFTER THE FIRE'S START, FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE LAUNCHED A SPECIAL INITIATIVE TO ASSIST COMMUNITY PARTNERS, EDUCATE THE PUBLIC AND ADVOCATE FOR THE POLICIES AND PROGRAMS NEEDED TO REBUILD TRAILS AND AID THE FOREST'S NATURAL REGENERATION.NOTABLE ACCOMPLISHMENTS OVER THE PAST YEAR INCLUDED: RAISING OVER $48,000 FOR THE HOOD RIVER COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE SEARCH AND RESCUE DIVISION; MOBILIZING PUBLIC OPINION TO BLOCK CONGRESSIONAL LEGISLATION DESIGNED TO OPEN FIRE-AFFECTED AREAS OF THE GORGE TO CLEAR-CUT LOGGING; CO-ORGANIZING A SERIES OF COMMUNITY FORUMS IN HOOD RIVER, TROUTDALE, AND PORTLAND, OREGON THAT REACHED OVER 1,000 PEOPLE COLLECTIVELY; AND LAUNCHING A NEW PUBLIC LAND STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM TO TRAIN AND DEPLOY TEAMS OF VOLUNTEERS TO AREAS PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE TO INVASIVE WEEDS AFTER THE FIRE. IN ITS FIRST FIVE MONTHS, THE NEW PROGRAM MOBILIZED JUST UNDER 200 VOLUNTEERS TO REMOVE ALMOST 8,000 GALLONS OF INVASIVE PLANTS FROM THE GORGE. LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG/2017-ACCOMPLISHMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO BE USED FOR THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF LANDS IN THE GORGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: LOBBYING - THE ORGANIZATION CONDUCTS LOBBY ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT LAWS THAT PROTECT THE GORGE'S SCENIC AND NATURAL BEAUTY. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMS - A LARGE CROSS SECTION OF PUBLIC SUPPORT IS CRITICAL IF WE ARE TO PRESERVE THE COLUMBIA GORGE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE SEEKS TO ACTIVELY EDUCATE AND MOBILIZE THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN OUR EFFORTS TO PROTECT AND STEWARD THE GORGE. A VITAL TOOL IN OUR BROADER PUBLIC EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS IS THE THOUSANDS OF DEDICATED FRIENDS' MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS AND ACTIVISTS WHO LIVE IN AND AROUND THE GORGE.FROM OFFERING EDUCATIONAL HIKES TO ORGANIZING COMMUNITY FORUMS, FRIENDS' PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM ANNUALLY MANAGES A DIVERSE ASSORTMENT OF COMMUNICATION, PUBLIC EDUCATION, OUTDOOR YOUTH EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH INITIATIVES. ACCOMPLISHMENTS OVER THE PAST YEAR INCLUDE BRINGING OVER 320 MIDDLE SCHOOL YOUTH FROM WASHOUGAL AND PORTLAND OUT TO THE GORGE AS PART OF FRIENDS' OUTDOOR EDUCATION PROGRAM; MOBILIZING OVER 390 VOLUNTEERS (FOR A COMBINED 5,022 VOLUNTEER HOURS) TO HELP SERVE AS LAND STEWARDS AND TRAILHEAD AMBASSADORS; AND PARTNERING WITH A NOTED LOCAL PHOTO STUDIO ON A MULTIMEDIA CAMPAIGN TO SPOTLIGHT THE WORK OF NINE COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO SERVE AS MODEL "CARETAKERS OF THE GORGE." LEARN MORE: WWW.GORGEFRIENDS.ORG/2017-ACCOMPLISHMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY REPRESENTATIVES OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO SUBMISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD REVIEWS POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ISSUES ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SALARY REVIEW WAS CONDUCTED BY THE BOARD. AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS RECUSED THEMSELVES AND A MOTION FOR COMPENSATION WAS OFFERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE FURNISHED UPON REQUEST. AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: FRIENDS OF THE COLUMBIA GORGE LAND TRUST
